summary: Frontend changes add explicit rendering of an incoming-call prompt in CallSurface, wire Answer/Decline to backend mutations with toast/error handling, and update WebRTC hook structure to buffer/process signals. Backend changes are truncated and do not provide enough evidence that Answer/Decline mutations correctly transition both participants’ call states as required.

missing_requirements.requirement: Clicking “Decline” moves the callee’s call status to #none and clears the caller’s call status back to #none; clicking “Answer” transitions both participants to #inCall (and WebRTC starts only after callee answers).
missing_requirements.reason: The diff summary shows frontend wiring for answer/decline, but the backend implementation that must mutate both participants’ call states is not shown (backend/main.mo is truncated before any answerCall/declineCall/endCall logic is visible). Without evidence of backend state transitions for both users, this requirement cannot be verified as implemented.
